wikipedia_page.main: Jane Brereton (1685–1740) was a Welsh poet who wrote in English. She was notable as a correspondent for The Gentleman's Magazine.

*Jane Brereton (1685–1740), née Hughes, Welsh poet who wrote in English

Back in England, the Lincoln poet who used the name Fidelia in The Gentleman's Magazine in 1734–1735 may have been Keziah (died 1742), a sister of John Wesley. She wrote belittling an award of £50 offered as a poetry prize ("you forget the price of a candle") and proposing instead that the prize should be the hand of Jonathan Swift in marriage. This sparked off exchanges of verses with the Welsh poet Jane Brereton (1685–1740) and the English poet Elizabeth Carter (1717–1806).
